solution_line_template: In one day the shop is losing {loss_per_day_val} thousand dollars, so during three days, the losses are {loss_per_day_val} * {num_closed_days} = ${total_loss_per_holiday}.

Christmas holidays are once a year, so in {num_years} years the shop "Surprise" could have earned another ${total_loss_per_holiday} * {num_years} = $<<{num_years}*{total_loss_per_holiday}={total_revenue_lost}>>{total_revenue_lost}.
